clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Delirium Severity by CAM-ICU 7 and 4C Mortality Score of the COVID-19 Patients in ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Relationship Between Delirium Severity by CAM-ICU 7 and 4C Mortality Score of the COVID-19 Patients in ICU

brief_summary.textblock: Aim: to investigate whether the 4C Mortality score, which measures the severity of COVID-19, and the CAM-ICU 7 score , which measures the severity of delirium, in ICU. To compare two scores in terms of the number of days without intubation and 28 day mortality rates in ICU.

arm_group.description: Covid-19 patients in ICU are screened for delirium and rated the severity with CAM-ICU 7 scores.

intervention.description: A 7-point rating scale (0-7) was derived from the CAM-ICU and RASS assessments 0-2: no delirium, 3-5: mild to moderate delirium, and 6-7: severe delirium.
4C Mortality Scores of the patients will be calculated, according to age, gender, number of comorbidities, respiratory rate, SpO2, GCS, urea, and CRP parameters

study_pop.textblock: Patients hospitalized in the intensive care unit diagnosed with COVID-19 will participate in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:Patients hospitalized in the intensive care unit diagnosed with COVID-19 will include in the study
Exclusion Criteria:there is no exclusion criteria
